ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Amazing class! I am so happy to have been part of this class and unique experience. It truly changed my way of thinking! I discovered the class by luck through a workshop that was offered. Thus, please try to communicate better to students about this unique class!

In regard to the homework assignments, they were often assigned just a couple of days before they were doing (usually reading assignments) and it was difficult to get them done in that timeframe, considering the myriad other commitments students have. A syllabus with all the readings for the semester would have been a good baseline, and changes could have easily been made if necessary throughout the semester. This practice did improve as the semester went on, but is worth noting.

The course was extremely valuable as a professional interested in engaging with different stakeholders, as well as an academic interested in better understanding network theories. The professor put so much time and energy into lectures, readings, and project support that the course was incredibly valuable and one of the most enlightening I've ever taken.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Cutting edge topic that is highly relevant and important to all people working on sustainability issues in today's world!!! I very much liked the class structure: lecture, time for discussion - definitely a class where you learn a lot from your peers! (given that I was not involved in specific client project work I cant speak to the client projects) ONE OF THE (next to industrial ecology) ONLY CLASSES AT YALE FES I EXPERIENCED THAT IS TRULY INTERDISCIPLINARY. WE SHOULD HAVE MORE CLASSES LIKE THIS AT FES!!! (TA's did a great job)
Paul was the best aspect of this course - his passion for the subject is contagious! He is super knowledgeable and really cares about student learning
The critical thinking about communications strategies was enlightening and well worth it.

The best aspects included lectures, which informed our projects and had immediate relevance to real world projects. The client projects built upon the theoretical knowledge in class, and I learned a lot more than I thought from listening to other groups' project work. I also liked having a 3-hr session because we could get into deeper discussion.
This courses teaches you how to see the big picture and think outside the box to solve it

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Communication towards students. I think this class should be mandatory for all F&ES students! The topic of communication is important and usually underrated by a lot of people/FES students! Paul does an incredible good job in introducing and guiding us to new cutting edge approaches to science communication. He facilitates session in a very engaged and motivating way. If you need more support in pushing this forward on this front I am happy to help! THIS IS IMPORTANT!!!!
Professor Lussier is obviously very smart and very talented, but a bit more organization would have been helpful for this course.

The only point I would note (which is to an extent, outside the professor and TA's control) is that if we were able to attract more students, the discussions would be richer and there would be a greater number of projects with more hands per project. Perhaps advertising the class as a clinic course (or just taking it for 1 credit) could help attract the attendance the course deserves.
Organization of assignments and team projects needs bench marks

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Great flow into lecture and discussions

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: applicable directly to everything I want to do in the future concerning career goals. Great class that fit directly with my Master thesis. I am sad I have not discovered this class and the professor earlier on in my time here at Yale (got to know about it only in my last semester). This is a class you need to be part for a longer time period to develop the cutting edge new ways of thinking!
I want all of my work to have a effective communications at its core
This course gives me both theoretical background for masters research as well as professional experience, which fosters more informed academic research in the first place.
This course taught me how to approach climate change from a systemic perspective.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interest and Master thesis fit. Also, because of the quality of the professor!
For the cool client projects we could work on

I took the course because I'm interested in how network theories help us understand the extent to which actions have an impact. I enjoyed and learned so much from the previous semester class (lectures and client project) that I knew I wanted to continue it.
To learn how to effectively communicate

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: overshot my expectations
Yes, amazing

I had very high expectations for the class because of how informative the last semester class was. The theory and project again exceeded my expectations, though I think greater student attendance could help make the course discussions even better.
blew me away!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

Advantages, were minimal Disadvantages: I did not enjoy my team, their work pace and personalities. It was hard working with undergraduate seniors as a graduate student. Different pace of life and they have never worked before, making it difficult to relate to real life.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This class will let you think totally differently about the world and how you communicate something that is dear to you. It is highly crucial in today's world and you definitely have to take it! unique class that teaches you network thinking, system thinking, cutting edge in everything related to communication & strategy
Take it!! You will learn SO much, and be greatly inspired
This course is going to continue to get better as it is taught. Be ready to be on your toes and learn a lot from Paul and his methodology.
I would just advise to stay in constant contact with the professor and/or TAs and/or client to ensure the project's success.
Pay attend, write everything down and wait for it. When Paul's work hits you, its like a ton of bricks and you will never think the same again.
